intro: Bisglaziovia behurioides, commonly known as the African snowbush, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features fleshy, blue-green leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern, adapted to store water in arid environments. The plant produces striking, star-shaped flowers in shades of white and yellow during the warmer months. It thrives in full sun and well-draining soil, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is a popular choice for low-maintenance landscaping.
